Description: Lapis lazuli scarab, elytra marked, pierced longitudinally, sides and base damaged.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Provenance not specified in the Museum register, but possibly from Tell Dafana or Tell Nabasha, according to the context of the item in the list, if not from another Eastern Delta site excavated by Petrie in 1886.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.49, p.66, p.181, pl.23)
